verse: In many ways and by many means God spoke in ancient times to our ancestors in the prophets;
but at the end of these days he spoke to us in a son.
For to which angel did God ever say, ‘You are my son, today I became your father’? Or, again, ‘I will be his father, and he will be my son’?

header: The Messiah Is Superior to Angels

verse: Again, when God brings the firstborn son into the world, he says,
In relation to the angels, this is what it says:
In relation to the son, however, it says,
But to which of the angels did God ever say,
Must we not say, then, that the angels are all servant spirits, sent to act on behalf of those who are to inherit salvation?
